definitions.definition: Soft, flexible, easily bent, formed, shaped, or molded.
definitions.example: You will find the clay perfectly pliable as long as it stays moist.

definitions.definition: Easily persuaded; yielding to influence.
A bone found in the penis of some mammals
A small rod-like structure found in spores and pollen
An article of loose clothing popular in 17th- and 18th century France.
A superior kind of rich silk formerly exported from Mantua in Italy.
A woman's cloak or mantle.
A woman's gown.
The condition of being inevitable.
An inevitable condition or outcome.
Having the characteristics of a wimp; feeble, indecisive, cowardly.

Any one of several species of small herring which are commonly preserved in olive oil or in tins for food, especially the pilchard, or European sardine Sardina pilchardus (syn. Clupea pilchardus). The California sardine Sardinops sagax (syn. Clupea sagax) is similar. The American sardines of the Atlantic coast are mostly the young of the Atlantic herring and of the menhaden.
Carnelian
Someone packed or crammed into a small space.
To order, command, control.
To speak in order for someone to write down the words.
definitions.example: She is dictating a letter to a stenographer.

definitions.definition: Meat from the shoulder of a cow or other animal.
Food.
A mechanical device that holds an object firmly in place, for example holding a drill bit in a high-speed rotating drill or grinder.
A chicken, a hen.
A clucking sound.
A friend or close acquaintance; term of endearment.
definitions.example: Are you all right, chuck?

definitions.definition: A gentle touch or tap.
definitions.example: She gave him an affectionate chuck under the chin.

definitions.definition: A casual throw.
A throw, an incorrect bowling action.
An act or instance of vomiting.
On rhythm guitar or mandolin etc., the muting of a chord by lifting the fretting fingers immediately after strumming, producing a percussive effect.
A small pebble.
(in the plural) Money.
A rodent of the family Sciuridae, belonging to the group of large ground squirrels known as marmots, Marmota monax.
To place in a chuck, or hold by means of a chuck, as in turning.
To bore or turn (a hole) in a revolving piece held in a chuck.
To make a clucking sound.
To call, as a hen her chickens.
To touch or tap gently.
To throw, especially in a careless or inaccurate manner.
definitions.example: Chuck that magazine to me, would you?

definitions.definition: To throw; to bowl with an incorrect action.
To discard, to throw away.
definitions.example: This food's gone off - you'd better chuck it.

definitions.definition: To jilt; to dump.
definitions.example: She's chucked me for another man!

definitions.definition: To vomit.
To leave; to depart; to bounce.
definitions.example: Let's chuck.

definitions.definition: To chuckle; to laugh.
On rhythm guitar or mandolin etc.: to mute a chord by lifting the fretting fingers immediately after strumming, producing a percussive effect.
The side of a tire.
definitions.example: If the puncture had been in the tread I could have had the tire patched, but it was in the sidewall and they can't fix that: they have to replace the whole tire.

definitions.definition: The wall forming the side of a structure; a side wall.
A young duck.
To take out of service or to render unusable.
definitions.example: The Army decommissioned the Sherman tank by filling the turret with cement.

definitions.definition: To remove or revoke a commission.
definitions.example: After his arrest, the officer was decommissioned from the police force.

definitions.definition: To remove or revoke a formal designation.
definitions.example: The state highway was decommissioned and reverted to local control.

definitions.definition: To make something form into crystals
definitions.example: I crystallized the copper sulphate by slowly cooling a saturated solution.

definitions.definition: To assume a crystalline form
definitions.example: The copper sulphate crystallized from solution.

definitions.definition: To give something a definite or precise form
definitions.example: After some thought, I crystallized my ideas for the paper.

definitions.definition: To take a definite form
definitions.example: My ideas crystallized overnight.

definitions.definition: To coat something with crystals, especially with sugar
definitions.example: We crystallized the fruit by coating in sugar.

definitions.definition: Having definitive and fixed form, solidified.
Being crystalline, in the form of crystals.
An act of retaliation.
Something taken from an enemy in retaliation.
The act of taking something from an enemy by way of retaliation or indemnity.
To affect with blight; to blast; to prevent the growth and fertility of.
To suffer blight.
definitions.example: This vine never blights.

definitions.definition: To spoil or ruin (something).
definitions.example: Those obscene tattoos are going to blight your job prospects.

definitions.definition: Having suffered a blight
Having caused to suffer a blight
Ruined, spoiled
Alternative letter-case form of Lucite
A mixture of water and soil or fine grained sediment.
A plaster-like mixture used to texture or smooth drywall.
(construction industry slang) Wet concrete as it is being mixed, delivered and poured.
Willfully abusive, even slanderous remarks or claims, notably between political opponents.
definitions.example: The campaign issues got lost in all the mud from both parties.

definitions.definition: Money, dough, especially when proceeding from dirty business.
(gay sex) Stool that is exposed as a result of anal sex.
A particle less than 62.5 microns in diameter, following the Wentworth scale
A black person.
Drilling fluid.
Coffee.
To make muddy or dirty; to apply mud to (something).
To make turbid.
To go under the mud, as an eel does.
To participate in a MUD or multi-user dungeon.
One of a series of sloped beams that extend from the ridge or hip to the downslope perimeter or eave, designed to support the roof deck and its associated loads.
A flock of turkeys.
A raftsman.
To make (timber, etc.) into rafters.
To furnish (a building) with rafters.
To plough so as to turn the grass side of each furrow upon an unploughed ridge; to ridge.
Any of various small passerine songbirds, especially of the family Sylviidae (Old World warblers) and Parulidae (New World warblers).
One who warbles.
A hissy fit.
To study an animal's anatomy by cutting it apart; to perform a necropsy or an autopsy.
To study a plant or other organism's anatomy similarly.
To analyze an idea in detail by separating it into its parts.
To separate muscles, organs, and so on without cutting into them or disrupting their architecture.
Of an infection or foreign material, following the fascia separating muscles or other organs.
A perennial herb, the wormwood species Artemisia dracunculus, from Europe and parts of Asia.
The leaves of this plant (either fresh, or preserved in vinegar / oil mixture) used as a seasoning.
To make a low, heavy, continuous sound.
definitions.example: I could hear the thunder rumbling in the distance.

definitions.definition: To discover deceitful or underhanded behaviour.
definitions.example: The police is going to rumble your hideout.

definitions.definition: To move while making a rumbling noise.
definitions.example: The truck rumbled over the rough road.

definitions.definition: To fight; to brawl.
(of a game controller) to provide haptic feedback by vibrating.
To cause to pass through a rumble, or polishing machine.
To murmur; to ripple.
A muted sound of complaint or discontent.
A deep low noise.

definitions.definition: Deep- and slow-sounding.
definitions.example: His rumbling voice suited the solemn occasion.

definitions.definition: Any of five isomeric aliphatic hydrocarbons, C6H14. They are colorless, volatile liquids.
Anything that can be perceived.
Able to be perceived, sensed, or discerned.
definitions.example: Her voice was barely perceptible over the noise, but her gestures made her meaning clear.

definitions.definition: A fire, especially a fast-burning fire producing a lot of flames and light.
Intense, direct light accompanied with heat.
definitions.example: to seek shelter from the blaze of the sun

definitions.definition: The white or lighter-coloured markings on a horse's face.
definitions.example: The palomino had a white blaze on its face.

definitions.definition: A high-visibility orange colour, typically used in warning signs and hunters' clothing.
A bursting out, or active display of any quality; an outburst.
A spot made on trees by chipping off a piece of the bark, usually as a surveyor's mark.
A hand consisting of five face cards.
Publication; the act of spreading widely by report
Hell
definitions.example: Where the blazes were you?

definitions.definition: To be on fire, especially producing bright flames.
definitions.example: The campfire blazed merrily.

definitions.definition: To send forth or reflect a bright light; shine like a flame.
To be conspicuous; shine brightly a brilliancy (of talents, deeds, etc.).
To set in a blaze; burn.
To cause to shine forth; exhibit vividly; be resplendent with.
(only in the past participle) To mark with a white spot on the face (as a horse).
To set a mark on (as a tree, usually by cutting off a piece of its bark).
To indicate or mark out (a trail, especially through vegetation) by a series of blazes.

definitions.definition: To set a precedent for the taking-on of a challenge; lead by example.

To smoke marijuana.
To blow, as from a trumpet
To publish; announce publicly

To blazon
Hellishly, extremely

definitions.definition: Expression of frustration, shock, or both.
A person who uses hypnotism to induce hypnosis in someone, either for entertainment or therapy.
A steep descent or declivity; steep face or edge of a ridge; ground about a fortified place, cut away nearly vertically to prevent hostile approach.
Any of a group of olive green magnesium-iron silicate minerals that crystallize in the orthorhombic system.
To make linear
To treat in a linear manner
Made linear, or treated in a linear manner.
To surround, form a circle around.
To move or go around completely.
To pass beyond the limits of something.
To surpass, as in intensity or power; to excel.
To climb; to mount.

definitions.definition: The act or process of eliminating segregation.
A unit equal to one million cycles per second.
The long, projecting nose, mouth, and jaw of a beast, as of pigs.

definitions.definition: The front of the prow of a ship or boat.
A person's nose.

definitions.definition: The nozzle of a pipe, hose, etc.

definitions.definition: The anterior prolongation of the head of a gastropod; a rostrum.

The terminus of a glacier.
A police informer.
A butterfly in the nymphalid subfamily Libytheinae, notable for the snout-like elongation on their heads.
To furnish with a nozzle or point.
Good; pleasing in appearance; attractive; comely; graceful; pleasant; desirable.
Quite large; considerable; sufficient; adequate; more than enough.

definitions.definition: In a goodly way; courteously, graciously.
Well; excellently.
In a philosophical manner.
One who is narrow-mindedly devoted to one's own ideas and groups, and intolerant of (people of) differing ideas, races, genders, religions, politics, etc.

To set a date for a proceeding in court, usually done by a judge at a calendar call.

definitions.definition: To enter or write in a calendar; to register.
Any of many closely related thorny plants in the genus Rubus including the blackberry and likely not including the raspberry proper.

To continue to exist.

The wood from this tree.

Of or relating to Austrian neurologist Sigmund Freud's scientific theory and psychotherapy called psychoanalysis.

Susceptible to analysis in terms of unconscious thoughts or desires.

To make (a bill) into law
To act the part of; to play

A thug; a usually muscular henchman with little intelligence (also known as a 'hired goon').
A fool; someone considered silly, stupid, awkward, or outlandish.

An excrescence on a horse's frush or frog.

To card or tease (wool) coarsely; to run through a scribbler.

definitions.definition: To tremble or shake.

All the classical traditions of the art and architecture of ancient Greece and Rome, especially the aspects of simplicity, elegance and proportion.
Classical scholarship.
A Latin or Ancient Greek expression used in an English sentence.

An honorific for specialists in spirituality.
A passing from one state to another; change; alteration; mutation.

A judge.

definitions.definition: Special weight or forcefulness given to something considered important.

A broad, shallow injury left by scraping (rather than a cut or a scratch).

definitions.definition: A fight, especially a fistfight without weapons.

definitions.definition: An awkward set of circumstances.

definitions.definition: A D and C or abortion; or, a miscarriage.
A shallow depression used by ground birds as a nest; a nest scrape.
A shallow pit dug as a hideout.
To draw (an object, especially a sharp or angular one), along (something) while exerting pressure.

definitions.definition: To remove (something) by drawing an object along in this manner.
definitions.example: Scrape the chewing gum off with a knife.

definitions.definition: To injure or damage by rubbing across a surface.
definitions.example: She tripped on a rock and scraped her knee.

definitions.definition: To barely manage to achieve.
definitions.example: I scraped a pass in the exam.

definitions.definition: To collect or gather, especially without regard to the quality of what is chosen.
definitions.example: Just use whatever you can scrape together.

definitions.definition: To play awkwardly and inharmoniously on a violin or similar instrument.
To draw back the right foot along the ground or floor when making a bow.

A type of fabric, often plastic, made to imitate the appearance of leather.
A person who dresses in leather or imitation leather.

definitions.definition: After the death of someone
definitions.example: Usage note: Posthumous awards are made when the intended recipient dies as a result of the action which merits the award. Even a short time lag between the action and the decision may cause the award to be conferred after death or there may be a longer delay such as when a review board decides to confer an award decades after a war has ended but such awards while they may be post mortem (literally, "after death") are not posthumous awards.

definitions.definition: Taking place after one's own death
definitions.example: Artists obscure during their life often receive posthumous recognition, too late for them to enjoy.

definitions.definition: In reference to a work, published after the author's death.
